alert.note: Alert for Mississippi (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 5:58PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Pulaski, Alexander, Ballard and northeastern Mississippi Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 558 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Olive Branch to near Horseshoe Lake Conservation Area to Wyatt. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Mounds and Mound City around 605 PM CDT. Wickliffe and Tamms around 610 PM CDT. Barlow around 615 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include La Center and Karnak. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 1 and 21. Interstate 57 in Missouri between Mile Markers 16 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for southern Illinois...western Kentucky...and southeastern Missouri.
